meanings.definition: A mythical water spirit or nymph.
meanings.sent1: Legends tell of nixies living in rivers and lakes.
meanings.sent2: The storybook mentioned the nixies dancing in the moonlight.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous nixies played pranks on fishermen by hiding their nets.
meanings.sent4: The shimmering nixies lured travelers with their enchanting songs.
meanings.sent5: Children giggled at the tales of nixies weaving water lilies into crowns.

meanings.sent1: I had to nixies my plans to go to the park due to the rain.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to nixies the field trip because of the bus issue.
meanings.sent3: She had to nixies her order at the restaurant when they ran out of her favorite dish.
meanings.sent4: The team decided to nixies the old logo and come up with a new design.
meanings.sent5: He had to nixies his vacation to help his friend with a project.

meanings.definition: A type of underwater creature in folklore.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the nixies were described as beautiful mermaid-like beings.
meanings.sent2: The sailors feared encountering the nixies during their voyages.
meanings.sent3: The nixies were said to guard hidden treasures deep in the ocean.
meanings.sent4: Legends spoke of nixies with scales that shimmered like precious gems.
meanings.sent5: The old fisherman claimed to have seen nixies dancing beneath the waves.
